analyzed: puggala paññatti
translated: Description of Persons

analyzed: niddesa
translated: The Niddesa

analyzed: ekaka puggala paññatti
translated: The Description of the Single Persons

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ samaya vimuttaḥ
translated: Who is the person liberated according to circumstances?

original: Idhekacco puggalo kālena kālaṁ samayena samayaṁ aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati, paññāya cassa disvā ekacce āsavā parikkhīṇā honti—
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo kālena kālam samayena samayam aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati paññāya ca ssa disvā ekacce āsavā parikkhīṇāḥ honti
translated: It is said of a person who from time to time, now and then, dwells having attained the eight liberations in due order, and who has, by seeing with wisdom, fully understood some of the defilements,

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ samaya vimutto
translated: that this is a person “liberated according to circumstances.”

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ a samaya vimuttaḥ
translated: Who is the person liberated not according to circumstances?

original: Idhekacco puggalo na heva kho kālena kālaṁ samayena samayaṁ aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati, paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā honti—
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ na ha iva kho kālena kālam samayena samayam aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati paññāya ca ssa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇāḥ honti
translated: It is said of a person who does not from time to time, now and then, dwell having attained the eight liberations in due order, and who has, by seeing with wisdom, fully understood some of the defilements,

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ a samaya vimuttaḥ
translated: that this is a person “liberated not according to circumstances.”

analyzed: sabbe api ariya puggalāḥ ariye vimokkhe asamaya vimuttā
translated: All noble persons are liberated not according to circumstances in the noble liberations.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo ku padhammo
translated: Who is the person of fluctuating temperament?

original: Idhekacco puggalo lābhī hoti rūpasahagatānaṁ vā arūpasahagatānaṁ vā samāpattīnaṁ.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ lābhī hoti rūpa sahagatānam vā arūpa sahagatānam vā
translated: It is said of a person who is a possessor of the attainments associated with form and the formless attainments,

original: So ca kho na nikāmalābhī hoti na akicchalābhī na akasiralābhī;
analyzed: saḥ ca kho na nikāma lābhī hoti na akiccha lābhī na akasira lābhī
translated: But he doesn’t attain them easily, without difficulty, or without trouble.

original: na yatthicchakaṁ yadicchakaṁ yāvaticchakaṁ samāpajjatipi vuṭṭhātipi.
analyzed: na yadicchakam yāvaticchakam samāpajjatipi vuṭṭhātipi
translated: He attains them only when he wants, only when he wills it, only when he strives.

original: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ vijjati, yaṁ tassa puggalassa pamādamāgamma tā samāpattiyo kuppeyyuṁ—
analyzed: ṭhānam kho pana etam vijjati yat tassa puggalassa pamādam āgamma tāḥ samāpattiyaḥ kuppeyyu
translated: It’s possible that, through negligence, he might lose those attainments.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ kuppa dhammo
translated: This is called a person of unstable character.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ a kuppa dhammo
translated: And what is a person of stable character?

original: Idhekacco puggalo lābhī hoti rūpasahagatānaṁ vā arūpasahagatānaṁ vā samāpattīnaṁ.🔽So ca kho nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī;
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ lābhī hoti rūpa sahagatānam vā arūpa sahagatānam vā  saḥ ca kho nikāma lābhī hoti a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī
translated: It’s a person who has attained the meditative absorption of the form-sphere or the formless-sphere.🔽He attains them easily, without difficulty, and without trouble.

analyzed: yatthicchakam yadicchakam yāvaticchakam samāpajjatipi vuṭṭhātipi
translated: He attains them when he wants, when he wills it, and when he strives.

original: Aṭṭhānametaṁ anavakāso yaṁ tassa puggalassa pamādamāgamma tā samāpattiyo kuppeyyuṁ—
analyzed: aṭṭhānam etam anavakāsaḥ yat tassa puggalassa pamādam āgamma tāḥ samāpattiyaḥ kuppeyyu
translated: It’s impossible that, through negligence, he might lose those attainments.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ a kuppa dhammaḥ
translated: This is called a person of stable character.

analyzed: sabbe api ariya puggalāḥ ariye vimokkhe akuppa dhammāḥ
translated: All noble persons are of stable character in regard to the noble release.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo parihāna dhammo
translated: And what is a person liable to fall?

original: Idhekacco puggalo lābhī hoti rūpasahagatānaṁ vā arūpasahagatānaṁ vā samāpattīnaṁ.🔽So ca kho na nikāmalābhī hoti na akicchalābhī na akasiralābhī;
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ lābhī hoti rūpa sahagatānam vā arūpa sahagatānam vā  saḥ ca kho na nikāma lābhī hoti na akiccha lābhī na akasira lābhī
translated: There is the case where a person is a frequenter of Arahants.

original: na yatthicchakaṁ yadicchakaṁ yāvaticchakaṁ samāpajjatipi vuṭṭhātipi.
analyzed: na yadicchakam yāvaticchakam samāpajjatipi vuṭṭhātipi
translated: He is not one who gains at will, without trouble or difficulty, the four jhānas that constitute the higher mind and provide a pleasant abiding in the here-and-now.

original: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ vijjati, yaṁ so puggalo pamādamāgamma tāhi samāpattīhi parihāyeyya—
analyzed: ṭhānam kho pana etat vijjati yat saḥ puggalaḥ pamādam āgamma tāhi samāpattīhi parihāyeyya
translated: It is possible that, with the break-up of the body, after death, he will be reborn in companionship with the devas of the heaven of the Four Great Kings.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ parihāna dhammo
translated: This is the person who is subject to falling away.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ a parihāna dhammo
translated: “And who is the person who is not subject to falling away?

original: Idhekacco puggalo lābhī hoti rūpasahagatānaṁ vā arūpasahagatānaṁ vā samāpattīnaṁ.🔽So ca kho nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī;
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ lābhī hoti rūpa sahagatānam vā arūpa sahagatānam vā  saḥ ca kho nikāma lābhī hoti a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī
translated: There is the case where a person is a frequenter of Arahants.

original: yatthicchakaṁ yadicchakaṁ yāvaticchakaṁ samāpajjatipi vuṭṭhātipi.🔽Aṭṭhānametaṁ anavakāso yaṁ so puggalo pamādamāgamma tāhi samāpattīhi parihāyeyya—
analyzed: yatthicchakam yadicchakam yāvaticchakam samāpajjatipi vuṭṭhātipi  aṭṭhānam etam anavakāsaḥ yam saḥ puggalaḥ pamādam āgamma tāhi samāpattīhi parihāyeyya
translated: He is one who gains at will, without trouble or difficulty, the four jhānas that constitute the higher mind and provide a pleasant abiding in the here-and-now.🔽It is impossible for him, with the break-up of the body, after death, to be reborn in companionship with the devas of the heaven of the Four Great Kings.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ a parihāna dhammo
translated: This is the person who is not subject to falling away.

analyzed: sabbe api ariya puggalāḥ ariye vimokkhe a parihāna dhammā
translated: All Noble Persons are incapable of falling away from the Noble Liberations.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo cetanābhabbo
translated: “What kind of person is capable of intending?

original: Idhekacco puggalo lābhī hoti rūpasahagatānaṁ vā arūpasahagatānaṁ vā samāpattīnaṁ.🔽So ca kho na nikāmalābhī hoti na akicchalābhī na akasiralābhī;
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ lābhī hoti rūpa sahagatānam vā arūpa sahagatānam vā  saḥ ca kho na nikāma lābhī hoti na akiccha lābhī na akasira lābhī
translated: There is the case where a person is a Realizer of the Cessation that is a State of Non-identification.🔽He is not one who attains it only through will, only through longing.

original: na yatthicchakaṁ yadicchakaṁ yāvaticchakaṁ samāpajjatipi vuṭṭhātipi.🔽Sace anusañceteti, na parihāyati tāhi samāpattīhi.
analyzed: na yadicchakam yāvaticchakam samāpajjatipi vuṭṭhātipi  sace anusañceta iti na parihāyati tāhi samāpattīhi
translated: He does not enter & remain in it only when he wants, only when he is in the mood, only when it seems good to him.🔽If he does not intend, he falls away from that attainment.

original: Sace na anusañceteti, parihāyati tāhi samāpattīhi—
analyzed: sace na anusañceta iti parihāyati tāhi samāpattīhi
translated: If he does intend, he does not fall away from that attainment.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo cetanābhabbo
translated: This is called a person who is capable of intending.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ anurakkhaṇābhabbo
translated: “What kind of person is capable of guarding?

original: Idhekacco puggalo lābhī hoti rūpasahagatānaṁ vā arūpasahagatānaṁ vā samāpattīnaṁ.🔽So ca kho na nikāmalābhī hoti na akicchalābhī na akasiralābhī;
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ lābhī hoti rūpa sahagatānam vā arūpa sahagatānam vā  saḥ ca kho na nikāma lābhī hoti na akiccha lābhī na akasira lābhī
translated: There is the case where a person is a Realizer of the Cessation that is a State of Non-identification.🔽He is not one who attains it only through will, only through longing.

original: na yatthicchakaṁ yadicchakaṁ yāvaticchakaṁ samāpajjatipi vuṭṭhātipi.
analyzed: na yadicchakam yāvaticchakam samāpajjatipi vuṭṭhātipi
translated: He does not enter & remain in it only when he wants, only when he is in the mood, only when it seems good to him.

original: Sace anurakkhati, na parihāyati tāhi samāpattīhi.
analyzed: sace anurakkhati na parihāyati tāhi samāpattīhi
translated: If he protects them, he doesn’t fall away from those attainments.

original: Sace na anurakkhati, parihāyati tāhi samāpattīhi—
analyzed: sace na anurakkhati parihāyati tāhi samāpattīhi
translated: If he doesn’t protect them, he falls away from those attainments.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ anurakkhaṇa ābhabbaḥ
translated: This is called a person who is capable of protecting.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ puthujjanaḥ
translated: And what is a person who is an ordinary person?

analyzed: yassa puggalassa tīṇi sayojanāni appahīnāni
translated: It’s a person who hasn’t given up the three lower fetters

original: na ca tesaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya paṭipanno—
analyzed: na ca tesam dhammānam pahānāya paṭipannaḥ
translated: and isn’t practicing for the purpose of letting go of them.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo puthujjano
translated: This is called a person who is an ordinary person.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ gotra bhū
translated: And what is a person who is a lineage holder?

original: Yesaṁ dhammānaṁ samanantarā ariyadhammassa avakkanti hoti tehi dhammehi samannāgato—
analyzed: yesam dhammānam samanantarā ariya dhammassa avakkanti hoti tehi dhammehi samannāgataḥ
translated: It’s a person who has the qualities that immediately precede the realization of the noble truths.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ gotra bhū
translated: This is called a person who is a lineage holder.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ bhaya uparataḥ
translated: And what is a person who is restrained by fear?

original: Satta sekkhā bhayūparatā, ye ca puthujjanā sīlavanto.
analyzed: satta sekkhāḥ bhaya uparatāḥ ye ca puthujjanā sīlavanto
translated: The seven kinds of noble disciples who are restrained by fear, and ordinary people who are virtuous.

analyzed: ara hā abhayūparato
translated: An perfected one is not restrained by fear.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ abhabba āgamanaḥ
translated: And what is a person who is incapable of discerning?

original: Ye te puggalā kammāvaraṇena samannāgatā, kilesāvaraṇena samannāgatā, vipākāvaraṇena
analyzed: ye te puggalā kamma āvaraṇena samannāgatā kilesa āvaraṇena samannāgatā vipāka āvaraṇena
translated: It’s a person who is obstructed by action, obstructed by defilements, and obstructed by the result.

original: samannāgatā, assaddhā acchandikā duppaññā eḷā, abhabbā niyāmaṁ okkamituṁ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṁ—
analyzed: samannāgatāḥ assaddhāḥ acchandikāḥ duppaññāḥ eḷāḥ abhabbāḥ niyāmam okkamitum kusalesu dhammesu
translated: They are lacking in faith, lacking in a sense of shame, lacking in moral dread, and lacking in wisdom. They are dull, and incapable of entering into the certainty of rightness in regard to skillful qualities.

analyzed: ime vuccanti puggalāḥ abhabba āgamanā
translated: These are called “people who are incapable of progress.”

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ bhabba āgamanaḥ
translated: And who is the person capable of progress?

original: Ye te puggalā na kammāvaraṇena samannāgatā, na kilesāvaraṇena samannāgatā, na vipākāvaraṇena
analyzed: ye te puggalāḥ na kamma āvaraṇena samannāgatāḥ na kilesa āvaraṇena samannāgatāḥ na vipāka āvaraṇena
translated: Those who are not hindered by the hindrance of kamma, not hindered by the hindrance of defilements, not hindered by the hindrance of ripening,

original: samannāgatā, saddhā chandikā paññavanto aneḷā, bhabbā niyāmaṁ okkamituṁ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṁ—
analyzed: samannāgatā saddhā chandikā paññavantaḥ aneḍāḥ bhabbāḥ niyāmam okkamitum kusalesu dhammesu
translated: who have faith, a sense of shame, moral dread, and wisdom. They are not dull, and are capable of entering into the certainty of rightness in regard to skillful qualities.

analyzed: ime vuccanti puggalāḥ bhabba āgamanā
translated: These are called “people who are capable of progress.”

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ niyataḥ
translated: And who is the person certain?

original: Pañca puggalā ānantarikā, ye ca micchādiṭṭhikā niyatā, aṭṭha ca ariyapuggalā niyatā.
analyzed: pañca puggalāḥ ānantarikāḥ ye ca micchādiṭṭhikāḥ niyatāḥ aṭṭha ca ariya puggalāḥ niyatā
translated: The five people who are on the immediate path, those who are fixed in wrongness, and the eight kinds of noble people who are fixed.

analyzed: avasesā puggalā aniyatā
translated: The rest are uncertain.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ paṭipannakaḥ
translated: And who is the person practicing?

original: Cattāro maggasamaṅgino puggalā paṭipannakā, cattāro phalasamaṅgino puggalā phale ṭhitā.
analyzed: cattāro magga samaṅginaḥ puggalā paṭipannakā cattāro phala samaṅginaḥ puggalā phale ṭhitā
translated: The four people who are endowed with the path are practicing, and the four people who are endowed with the fruit are established in the fruit.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ samasīsī
translated: And who is the person with a developed mind?

original: Yassa puggalassa apubbaṁ acarimaṁ āsavapariyādānañca hoti jīvitapariyādānañca—
analyzed: yassa puggalassa apubbam acarimam āsava pariyādānañca hoti jīvita pariyādānañca
translated: There is the person in whom both the destruction of the pollutants and the end of life occur simultaneously.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ samasīsī
translated: This is called the person who is “equal in head”.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ ṭhita kappī
translated: And what is the person who is “standing in the aeon”?

original: Ayañca puggalo sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno assa, kappassa ca uḍḍayhanavelā assa, neva tāva kappo uḍḍayheyya yāvāyaṁ puggalo na sotāpattiphalaṁ sacchikaroti.
analyzed: ayam ca puggalo sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannaḥ assa kappassa ca uḍḍayhana velā assa na iva tāva kappo uḍḍayheyya yāvā ayam puggalo na sotāpatti phalam sacchikaroti
translated: And this person is practising for the realisation of the fruit of stream-entry, and the aeon is about to be destroyed, but the aeon will not be destroyed until this person has realised the fruit of stream-entry.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ ṭhita kappī
translated: This is called the person who is “standing in the aeon”.

analyzed: sabbe api magga samaṅginaḥ puggalāḥ ṭhita kappinaḥ
translated: All persons who possess the path are standing in the aeon.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ ariyaḥ
translated: And what is the person who is “noble”?

analyzed: aṭṭha ariya puggalāḥ ariyā
translated: The eight noble persons are noble.

analyzed: avasesā puggalā anariyā
translated: The rest of the persons are not noble.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ sekkhaḥ
translated: And what is the person who is “in training”?

analyzed: cattāro magga samaṅginaḥ tayo phala samaṅginaḥ puggalā sekkhā
translated: The four persons who possess the path and the three persons who possess the fruit are “in training”.

analyzed: arahā asekkhaḥ
translated: The perfected one is “beyond training”.

analyzed: avasesāḥ puggalāḥ na ivasekkha na asekkhā
translated: The rest of the persons are “neither in training nor beyond training”.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ tevijjaḥ
translated: And what is the person who is “possessing three knowledges”?

analyzed: tīhi vijjāhi samannāgataḥ puggalo tevijjaḥ
translated: The person who possesses three knowledges is “possessing three knowledges”.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo chaṭṭha abhiñño
translated: And what’s a person who has the six knowledges?

analyzed: chahi abhiññāhi samannāgato puggalo chaḍḍabhiñño
translated: A person who has the six knowledges is a person who has the six knowledges.

original: Katamo ca puggalo sammāsambuddho?🔽Idhekacco puggalo pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu sāmaṁ saccāni abhisambujjhati;
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ sammāsambuddhaḥ  idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu sāmam saccāni abhisambujjhati
translated: And what’s a person who is fully awakened?

original: tattha ca sabbaññutaṁ pāpuṇāti, balesu ca vasībhāvaṁ—
analyzed: tattha ca sabbaññu tam pāpuṇāti balesu ca vasībhāva
translated: It’s a person who, in regard to previously unheard teachings, awakens to the truths by himself and understands: ‘These things have never been heard before. They are for one’s own welfare, for the welfare of others, and for the welfare of both. They are for the good, the welfare, and the happiness of gods and humans.’🔽He attains all-knowingness and mastery over all the elements.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ sammāsambuddhaḥ
translated: This is called a person who is fully awakened.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ paccekasambuddhaḥ
translated: And what’s a person who is a solitary buddha?

original: Idhekacco puggalo pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu sāmaṁ saccāni abhisambujjhati;
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu sāmam saccāni abhisambujjhati
translated: It’s a person who, in regard to previously unheard teachings, awakens to the truths by himself and understands: ‘These things have never been heard before. They are for one’s own welfare, for the welfare of others, and for the welfare of both. They are for the good, the welfare, and the happiness of gods and humans.’

original: na ca tattha sabbaññutaṁ pāpuṇāti, na ca balesu vasībhāvaṁ—
analyzed: na ca tattha sabbaññu tam pāpuṇāti na ca balesu
translated: But he doesn’t attain all-knowingness and mastery over all the elements.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ paccekasambuddhaḥ
translated: This is called a person who is a solitary buddha.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ
translated: And what’s a person who is free in both ways?

original: Idhekacco puggalo aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati;🔽paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā honti—
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati  paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇāḥ honti
translated: It’s a person who has realized the four noble truths and abides in the ending of the corruptions.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ
translated: This is called a person who is free in both ways.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo paññā vimutto
translated: “And what kind of person is liberated by wisdom?

original: Idhekacco puggalo na heva kho aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati;
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ na ha iva kho aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati
translated: There is the case where a person does not dwell having contacted with the body and abides only by way of view and philosophy.

original: paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā honti.
analyzed: paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇāḥ honti
translated: But his effluents, brought to presence, are abandoned.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo paññā vimutto
translated: This is called a person liberated by wisdom.

original: Katamo ca puggalo kāyasakkhī?🔽Idhekacco puggalo aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati;
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo kāya sakkhī  idha ekaccaḥ puggalo aṭṭha vimokkhe kāyena phusitvā viharati
translated: “And what kind of person is a body witness?🔽There is the case where a person dwells having contacted with the body and abides by way of view and philosophy.

original: paññāya cassa disvā ekacce āsavā parikkhīṇā honti.
analyzed: paññāya cassa disvā ekacce āsavā parikkhīṇā honti
translated: But his effluents, brought to presence, are abandoned.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo kāya sakkhī
translated: This is called a person who is a body witness.

original: Katamo ca puggalo diṭṭhippatto?🔽Idhekacco puggalo “idaṁ dukkhan”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo”ti🔽yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhanirodho”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo diṭṭhi ppatto  idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ idam dukkhanti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha samudayaḥ ti  yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodhaḥ iti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī
translated: “And what kind of person is one attained to view?

analyzed: yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: There is the case where a person discerns, as it actually is, that ‘This is stress… This is the origination of stress… This is the cessation of stress… This is the way leading to the cessation of stress… These are effluents… This is the origination of effluents… This is the cessation of effluents… This is the way leading to the cessation of effluents.’

original: Tathāgatappaveditā cassa dhammā paññāya vodiṭṭhā honti vocaritā.
analyzed: tathāgata ppaveditā ca assa dhammā paññāya vodiṭṭhāḥ honti vocaritā
translated: And the qualities proclaimed by the Tathāgata are well penetrated by him with discernment.

original: Paññāya cassa disvā ekacce āsavā parikkhīṇā honti—
analyzed: paññāya cassa disvā ekacce āsavā parikkhīṇā honti
translated: and some of his defilements have been exhausted by his seeing with wisdom.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo diṭṭhi ppatto
translated: This is called a person who has attained to view.

original: Katamo ca puggalo saddhāvimutto?🔽Idhekacco puggalo “idaṁ dukkhan”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo”ti
analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ saddhā vimuttaḥ  idha ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ idam dukkhanti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha samudayaḥ ti
translated: What is a person who is freed by faith?

original: yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhanirodho”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, “ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī🔽paṭipadā”ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
analyzed: yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodhaḥ iti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī  yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: There is the case where a person discerns, as it has come to be, that ‘This is stress … This is the origination of stress … This is the cessation of stress … This is the way leading to the cessation of stress.

original: Tathāgatappaveditā cassa dhammā paññāya vodiṭṭhā honti vocaritā.
analyzed: tathāgata ppaveditā ca assa dhammā paññāya vodiṭṭhāḥ honti vocaritā
translated: The Dhamma of the Tathāgata is well-expounded … and leads to Nibbāna.’

original: Paññāya cassa disvā ekacce āsavā parikkhīṇā honti, no ca kho yathā diṭṭhippattassa—
analyzed: paññāya cassa disvā ekacce āsavā parikkhīṇāḥ honti no ca kho yathā diṭṭhippattassa
translated: and some of his defilements have been exhausted by his seeing with wisdom, but not to the extent that he has attained to view.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo saddhā vimutto
translated: This is called a person who is freed by faith.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ dhamma anusārī
translated: What is a person who is a Dhamma-follower?

original: Yassa puggalassa sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa paññindriyaṁ adhimattaṁ hoti, paññāvāhiṁ paññāpubbaṅgamaṁ ariyamaggaṁ bhāveti—
analyzed: yassa puggalassa sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa paññindriyam adhimattam hoti paññā vāhim paññā pubbaṅgamam ariya maggam bhāveti
translated: There is the case where a person is practicing for the realization of the fruit of stream-entry. His faculty of discernment is superior, and he develops the noble eightfold path to its culmination.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ dhamma anusārī
translated: This is called a person who is a follower by way of the Dhamma.

original: Sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno puggalo dhammānusārī phale ṭhito diṭṭhippatto.
analyzed: sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannaḥ puggalaḥ dhamma anusārī phale ṭhitaḥ diṭṭhippatto
translated: A person who is practicing for the realization of the fruit of stream-entry is a follower by way of the Dhamma when established in the fruit is one who has attained to view.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ saddhā anusārī
translated: And what is a person who is a follower by faith?

original: Yassa puggalassa sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa saddhindriyaṁ adhimattaṁ hoti, saddhāvāhiṁ saddhāpubbaṅgamaṁ ariyamaggaṁ bhāveti—
analyzed: yassa puggalassa sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannassa saddhi indriyam adhimattam hoti saddhā vāhim saddhā pubbaṅgamam ariya maggam bhāveti
translated: It’s a person who is practicing for the realization of the fruit of stream-entry, in whom the faculty of faith is outstanding, who develops the noble eightfold path whose forerunner is faith.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ saddhā anusārī
translated: This is called a person who is a follower by faith.

original: Sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno puggalo saddhānusārī phale ṭhito saddhāvimutto.
analyzed: sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannaḥ puggalaḥ saddhā anusārī phale ṭhitaḥ saddhā vimutto
translated: A person who is practicing for the realization of the fruit of stream-entry is a follower by faith when established in the fruit is one who is freed by faith.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ satta kkhattu paramaḥ
translated: And what is a person who is a one-seeder?

original: Idhekacco puggalo tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyano.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo tiṇṇam sayojanānam parikkhayā sotāpannaḥ hoti a vinipāta dhammo niyataḥ sambodhi parāyano
translated: It’s a person who, with the ending of three fetters, is a stream-enterer, no longer bound to the nether world, fixed in destiny, heading for enlightenment.

original: So sattakkhattuṁ deve ca mānuse ca sandhāvitvā saṁsaritvā dukkhassantaṁ karoti—
analyzed: saḥ sattakkhattum deve ca mānuse ca sandhāvitvā sasaritvā dukkhassantam karoti
translated: Having transmigrated up to seven times among gods and humans, he makes an end of suffering.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ satta kkhattu paramaḥ
translated: This is called a person who is a one-seeder.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo kolaṅkolo
translated: “And what’s a person who is a repeater?

original: Idhekacco puggalo tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyano.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo tiṇṇam sayojanānam parikkhayā sotāpannaḥ hoti a vinipāta dhammo niyataḥ sambodhi parāyano
translated: It’s a person who, with the ending of three fetters, is a stream-enterer, no longer bound to the nether world, fixed in destiny, heading for enlightenment.

original: So dve vā tīṇi vā kulāni sandhāvitvā saṁsaritvā dukkhassantaṁ karoti—
analyzed: saḥ dve vā tīṇi vā kulāni sandhāvitvā sasaritvā dukkhassantam karoti
translated: After wandering among humans and gods seven times at most, he makes an end of suffering.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo kolaṅkolo
translated: This is called a person who is a repeater.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ eka bījī
translated: “And what’s a person who is a one-seeded?

original: Idhekacco puggalo tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyano.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo tiṇṇam sayojanānam parikkhayā sotāpannaḥ hoti a vinipāta dhammo niyataḥ sambodhi parāyano
translated: It’s a person who, with the ending of three fetters, is a stream-enterer, no longer bound to the nether world, fixed in destiny, heading for enlightenment.

original: So ekaṁyeva mānusakaṁ bhavaṁ nibbattetvā dukkhassantaṁ karoti—
analyzed: saḥ ekayā iva mānusakam bhavam nibbattetvā dukkhassantam karoti
translated: After being reborn as a human being just one time, he makes an end of suffering.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ eka bījī
translated: This is called a person who is a one-seeded.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalo sakadāgāmī
translated: “And what’s a person who is a once-returner?

original: Idhekacco puggalo tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā rāgadosamohānaṁ tanuttā sakadāgāmī hoti, sakideva imaṁ lokaṁ āgantvā dukkhassantaṁ karoti—
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo tiṇṇam sayojanānam parikkhayā rāga dosa mohānam tanuttā sakadāgāmī hoti sakideva imam lokam āgantvā dukkhassantam karoti
translated: It’s a person who, with the ending of three fetters, and the weakening of greed, hate, and delusion, is a once-returner. After returning only once to this world, they make an end of suffering.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ sakadāgāmī
translated: This is called a person who is a once-returner.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ anāgāmī
translated: “And what’s a person who is a non-returner?

original: Idhekacco puggalo pañcannaṁ orambhāgiyānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti, tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā—
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo pañcannam orambhāgiyānam sayojanānam parikkhayā opapātikaḥ hoti tattha parinibbāyī an āvatti dhammo tasmā lokā
translated: There is the person who, with the destruction of the five lower fetters, is due to reappear spontaneously in the Pure Abodes and there attain final Nibbana, without ever returning from that world.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ anāgāmī
translated: This is called the non-returner.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ antarā parinibbāyī
translated: What is the person who attains Nibbana in the interval?

original: Idhekacco puggalo pañcannaṁ orambhāgiyānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti, tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.🔽So upapannaṁ vā samanantarā appattaṁ vā vemajjhaṁ āyuppamāṇaṁ ariyamaggaṁ sañjaneti upariṭṭhimānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ pahānāya—
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo pañcannam orambhāgiyānam sayojanānam parikkhayā opapātikaḥ hoti tattha parinibbāyī an āvatti dhammo tasmā lokā  saḥ upapannam vā samanantarā appattam vā vemajjham āyu ppamāṇam ariya maggam sañjaneti upariṭṭhimānam sayojanānam pahānāya
translated: There is the person who, with the destruction of the five lower fetters, is due to reappear spontaneously in the Pure Abodes and there attain final Nibbana, without ever returning from that world.🔽But as soon as he is reborn there, by the destruction of the taints, he attains Nibbana in this very life.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ antarā parinibbāyī
translated: This is called the person who attains Nibbana in the interval.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ upahacca parinibbāyī
translated: What is the person who attains Nibbana upon landing?

original: Idhekacco puggalo pañcannaṁ orambhāgiyānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti, tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo pañcannam orambhāgiyānam sayojanānam parikkhayā opapātikaḥ hoti tattha parinibbāyī an āvatti dhammo tasmā lokā
translated: There is the person who, with the destruction of the five lower fetters, is due to reappear spontaneously in the Pure Abodes and there attain final Nibbana, without ever returning from that world.

original: So atikkamitvā vemajjhaṁ āyuppamāṇaṁ upahacca vā kālakiriyaṁ ariyamaggaṁ sañjaneti upariṭṭhimānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ pahānāya—
analyzed: saḥ atikkamitvā vemajjham āyu ppamāṇam upahacca vā kālakiriyam ariya maggam sañjaneti upariṭṭhimānam sayojanānam pahānāya
translated: Having gone beyond the middle of the life-span, he generates the noble path for the purpose of abandoning the fetters that remain, either before or after reaching the end of the life-span.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ upahacca parinibbāyī
translated: This is called a person who attains Nibbāna early in his next existence.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ asaṅkhāra parinibbāyī
translated: What is a person who attains Nibbāna without prompting?

original: Idhekacco puggalo pañcannaṁ orambhāgiyānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti, tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo pañcannam orambhāgiyānam sayojanānam parikkhayā opapātikaḥ hoti tattha parinibbāyī an āvatti dhammo tasmā lokā
translated: Here someone, with the destruction of the five lower fetters, becomes one spontaneously reborn, due to attain final nibbana there without returning from that world.

original: So asaṅkhārena ariyamaggaṁ sañjaneti upariṭṭhimānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ pahānāya—
analyzed: saḥ asaṅkhārena ariya maggam sañjaneti upariṭṭhimānam sayojanānam pahānāya
translated: He generates the noble path without prompting for the purpose of abandoning the fetters that remain.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ asaṅkhāra parinibbāyī
translated: This is called a person who attains Nibbāna without prompting.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ sa saṅkhāra parinibbāyī
translated: What is a person who attains Nibbāna through prompting?

original: Idhekacco puggalo pañcannaṁ orambhāgiyānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti, tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo pañcannam orambhāgiyānam sayojanānam parikkhayā opapātikaḥ hoti tattha parinibbāyī an āvatti dhammo tasmā lokā
translated: Here someone, with the destruction of the five lower fetters, becomes one spontaneously reborn, due to attain final nibbana there without returning from that world.

original: So sasaṅkhārena ariyamaggaṁ sañjaneti upariṭṭhimānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ pahānāya—
analyzed: saḥ sa saṅkhārena ariya maggam sañjaneti upariṭṭhimānam sa yojanānam pahānāya
translated: He generates the noble path through prompting for the purpose of abandoning the fetters that remain.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ sa saṅkhāra parinibbāyī
translated: This is called a person who attains Nibbāna through exertion.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ uddha sotaḥ akaniṭṭha gāmī
translated: What is a person who goes upstream to the highest gods?

original: Idhekacco puggalo pañcannaṁ orambhāgiyānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti, tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
analyzed: idha ekaccaḥ puggalo pañcannam orambhāgiyānam sayojanānam parikkhayā opapātikaḥ hoti tattha parinibbāyī an āvatti dhammo tasmā lokā
translated: There is the case where a certain person, with the ending of the effluents, enters & remains in the effluent-free awareness-release & discernment-release, directly knowing & realizing it for himself right in the here & now.

original: So avihā cuto atappaṁ gacchati, atappā cuto sudassaṁ gacchati, sudassā cuto sudassiṁ gacchati, sudassiyā cuto akaniṭṭhaṁ gacchati;
analyzed: saḥ avihā cutaḥ atappam gacchati atappā cutaḥ sudassam gacchati sudassā cutaḥ sudassim gacchati sudassiyā cutaḥ akaniṭṭham gacchati
translated: He goes from the Aviha realm to the Atappa realm, from the Atappa realm to the Sudassa realm, from the Sudassa realm to the Sudassi realm, from the Sudassi realm to the Akaniṭṭha realm,

original: akaniṭṭhe ariyamaggaṁ sañjaneti upariṭṭhimānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ pahānāya—
analyzed: akaniṭṭhe ariya maggam sañjaneti upariṭṭhimānam sayojanānam pahānāya
translated: where he generates the noble eightfold path for the abandoning of the fetters above.

original: ayaṁ vuccati puggalo “uddhaṁsoto akaniṭṭhagāmī”.🔽Katamo ca puggalo sotāpanno sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno?🔽Tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ pahānāya paṭipanno puggalo sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno.
analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo uddha sotaḥ akaniṭṭha gāmī  katamaḥ ca puggalaḥ sotāpannaḥ sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipanno  tiṇṇam sayojanānam pahānāya paṭipanno puggalo sotāpatti phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipanno
translated: This is called a person who goes upstream to the highest gods.🔽What is a person who is a stream-winner, entering & remaining in the fruit of stream-entry?🔽One who is practicing for the abandoning of the three fetters is a person who is a stream-winner, entering & remaining in the fruit of stream-entry.

analyzed: yassa puggalassa tīṇi sayojanāni pahīnāni
translated: One in whom the three fetters have been abandoned is a person who is a stream-winner, entering & remaining in the fruit of stream-entry.

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalo sotāpanno
translated: This is called a person who is a stream-enterer.

original: Kāmarāgabyāpādānaṁ tanubhāvāya paṭipanno puggalo sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno.
analyzed: kāma rāga byāpādānam tanu bhāvāya paṭipanno puggalo sakadāgāmi phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipanno
translated: A person who is practicing to reduce lust and hatred is practicing for the realization of the fruit of once-returning.

analyzed: yassa puggalassa kāma rāga byāpādā tanu bhūtā
translated: A person in whom lust and hatred have been reduced

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ sakadāgāmī
translated: is called a person who is a once-returner.

original: Kāmarāgabyāpādānaṁ anavasesappahānāya paṭipanno puggalo anāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno.
analyzed: kāma rāga byāpādānam anavasesa ppahānāya paṭipannaḥ puggalaḥ anāgāmi phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipannaḥ
translated: A person who is practicing to completely abandon lust and hatred is practicing for the realization of the fruit of non-returning.

analyzed: yassa puggalassa kāma rāga byāpādāḥ anavasesāḥ pahīnā
translated: A person in whom lust and hatred have been completely abandoned

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ anāgāmī
translated: is called a person who is a non-returner.

original: Rūparāgaarūparāgamānauddhaccaavijjāya anavasesappahānāya paṭipanno puggalo arahattaphalasacchikiriyāya paṭipanno.
analyzed: rūpa rāga arūpa rāga māna auddhacca avijjāya anavasesa ppahānāya paṭipannaḥ puggalaḥ arahatta phala sacchikiriyāya paṭipanno
translated: A person who is practicing to completely abandon lust for the formless, conceit, restlessness, and ignorance is practicing for the realization of the fruit of perfection.

original: Yassa puggalassa rūparāgo arūparāgo māno uddhaccaṁ avijjā anavasesā pahīnā—
analyzed: yassa puggalassa rūpa rāgaḥ arūpa rāgaḥ mānaḥ uddhaccam avijjā anavasesā pahīnā
translated: A person in whom lust for the formless, conceit, restlessness, and ignorance have been completely abandoned

analyzed: ayam vuccati puggalaḥ arahā
translated: is called a person who is perfected.

analyzed: ekaka niddeso
translated: The section on one type of person is finished.
